prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle with four lines: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.375] - line_3: Start Point [0.375, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.375] - line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.375. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.025] 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.025 units towards the normal and 0 units opposite the normal to create a 3D solid. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.075, 0.075, 0.05] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a circle with the following properties: - Center: [0.1125, 0.1125] - Radius: 0.1125 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.225. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.075, 0.075, 0.025] 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.7 units towards the normal and 0 units opposite the normal to create a 3D solid. Combine the resulting solid with the previous part using a join operation. The final shape will be a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The top and bottom are rectangular and meet at right angles. The height of the final shape is approximately 0.775 units, the width is approximately 0.45 units, and the length is approximately 0.45 units.</description>
